['Salve - A soothing ointment used to heal wounds or skin irritations.', 'Balm - A fragrant, medicinal oil often applied as an ointment for its therapeutic properties.', "Cream - Ointments that have a higher water content than solid oils and can be used on the skin's surface.", 'Lotion - Non-medicated moisturizing products, which may resemble ointments in consistency but are not classified as such.', 'Hydrocortisone cream - A medicated ointment containing corticosteroids used to reduce inflammation and itching on the skin.', 'Petroleum jelly - An occlusive substance often included in emollient ointments for its ability to seal moisture into the skin.', 'Calendula oil - A medicinal oil made from marigold petals used as an ointment or topical treatment for soothing and healing skin irritations.', 'Witch hazel - An astringent extract often found in ointments to help reduce inflammation, redness, and itching on the skin.', 'Zinc oxide - A common ingredient in over-the-counter ointments used for its protective properties against sunburns and rashes.', 'Aloe vera gel - Often combined with other medicinal ingredients, aloe vera is known for soothing the skin when applied as an ointment or gel.', "Beeswax - A natural wax used in some ointments to help solidify and stabilize the product's consistency while providing a protective barrier on the skin.", 'Neomycin/Bacitracin/Polymyxin (Neosporin) - An over-the-counter topical antibiotic ointment used to prevent infection on minor cuts, scrapes, and burns.', 'Hydromorphone ointment - A potent pain relief medication formulated as an ointment for localized delivery when administered by a healthcare professional.', 'Tacrolimus (Protopic) - An immunosuppressant ointment used to treat eczema and other skin conditions.', 'Ciclosporin A (Neoral) - Another immunosuppressive medication available as an ointment for treating severe cases of psoriasis and rheumatoid arthritis.', 'Fusidic acid cream - An antibiotic ointment used to treat various skin infections caused by staphylococcus bacteria.', 'Dermatophyte test (Tinea) - A diagnostic tool, not an ointment, but some dermatologists may use a specialized "patch" containing fungal elements during testing to determine if skin infections are caused by dermatophytes.', "Antifungal cream - Medicated topical treatments used for combating various types of skin infections and conditions, including athlete's foot or ringworm.", 'Antihistamine ointment - A medication applied directly to the skin to alleviate symptoms caused by allergic reactions like rashes, itching, and inflammation.', 'Mupirocin (Bactroban) - An antibiotic ointment used for treating bacterial infections of the skin or nose.', 'Lidocaine patch - A transdermal pain relief medication available as an adhesive patch to deliver localized lidocaine analgesia, not a conventional ointment.', 'Emollient cream - Non-medicated products used primarily for moisturizing the skin and relieving dryness or itchiness; they may resemble some characteristics of ointments in texture but are distinct from traditional medicinal preparations.']

['Breach - an opening or gap in something, such as a wall or barrier.', 'Split - to separate forcibly into two or more parts; divide apart.', 'Fracture - the cracking or breaking of a hard object or material under stress.', 'Burst - suddenly burst forth from a confined space with violence, such as an explosion.', 'Crack - a narrow line-like break in something, especially rock, earth, or other surface layers.', 'Rupture - the act of breaking or bursting forcibly and violently; tear apart.', 'Leak - to escape from a container through a hole or crack; discharge slowly but steadily.', 'Breakdown - the collapse or failure of a system, machine, structure, etc., often due to stress or damage.', 'Disintegration - the process of breaking down into smaller pieces or fragments; fall apart.', 'Shattering - the act of shattering something into small fragments; break violently and noisily.', 'Collapse - a sudden falling inward or in greater part; give way under pressure, weight, etc.', 'Fissure - a long narrow crack, split, or fracture in a rock surface.', 'Tearing - to pull apart or divide something forcefully, often resulting in damage or rupturing.', 'Fragmentation - the process of breaking up into smaller pieces or fragments.', 'Splitting - separating or dividing forcibly and violently; break apart.', 'Disruption - an interruption in the normal flow, pattern, or functioning of something.', 'Separation - the action or state of being separated from a larger whole.', 'Fault line - a fracture zone between two blocks of land, which may be associated with earthquakes and other geological phenomena.', 'Hole - an opening in something that allows it to be penetrated; a cavity or void.', 'Cataclysmic rupture - a violent and sudden breakup or destruction of a system, structure, or natural phenomenon (e.g., earthquake).']

['Inuit - The indigenous people who have inhabited the Arctic regions, including Greenland.', 'Kalaallit - A subgroup of the Inuit native to Greenland; specifically referring to those residing in western and northwestern parts of the island.', 'Thule - An ancient group that is considered a precursor to modern Inuit people who once inhabited Greenland.', 'Greenlandic - The language spoken by the native inhabitants, derived from the Eskimo-Aleut languages.', 'Aappalattoq (Mirror Image) - A traditional shamanistic title held among Inuit communities in Greenland known for their ability to mimic movements and voices.', 'Kiviuq - An ancient legendary hero from the Norse sagas, who is often associated with early settlers of Greenland.', "Arctic Circle - The imaginary line that encircles the Earth's northernmost part, where during summer months there are at least one full day and one full night per year; a region inhabited by many Inuit communities.", 'Qaanaaq - A village in northwestern Greenland with a population primarily of native inhabitants from the Thule culture.', "Sermersooq - The largest administrative region within Greenland, home to more than 48% of Greenland's population, consisting mainly of Inuit communities.", 'Nanook (Nanu) - An Inuit term referring to the polar bear, an animal commonly associated with Arctic cultures and native inhabitants of Greenland.', 'Qawiaraq - A subgroup of Inuit living in northwest Greenland; known for their traditional hunting practices and distinct cultural identity.', 'Tasiilaq (Nuuk) - The largest town, and capital city, within the Sermersooq municipality in southern Greenland, where a significant portion of native inhabitants reside.', 'Pituffik Island (Disco Island) - A small island off the western coast of Greenland, which is home to a community consisting mainly of native Inuit people.', "Qaarsut (Qullissat) - A former Norse settlement in east-central Greenland; though abandoned by settlers long ago, it's still inhabited by modern native inhabitants as an archaeological site and tourist destination.", 'Ammassalik Island - One of the easternmost islands within Northeast Greenland, mainly inhabited by Inuit communities with a distinct cultural heritage.', 'Tuttulik - A traditional type of skin boat used for transportation across ice-covered waters in Greenland; often utilized by native inhabitants as part of their hunting practices.', 'Qaanaaq Hunters (Uummannaq) - Refers to a group of Inuit hunters from the northernmost point of Greenland, whose activities were once documented in Norse sagas and medieval European records.', 'Eskimokkiut/Eskimo (Greenlandic/Inuktitut) - The ethnic term used to describe native inhabitants of both Alaska and Canada as well as the Inuit and Yupik people who inhabit Greenland, collectively referred to as "Eskimos" historically']
